strategy: Apply a dynamic threshold-based strategy where the row player monitors the opponent’s move history and computes a "cooperation score" — the proportion of times the opponent chose the same option as the row player in the last 5 rounds. If the cooperation score exceeds 0.6, the row player shifts to a 90% chance of matching the opponent’s choice (i.e., coordinate). Otherwise, they adopt a 50% chance of choosing Movie and 50% of choosing Game, introducing symmetry to avoid predictable patterns.
